results.title: Independence day (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Centropolis Entertainment, Dean Devlin and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: One of the biggest box office hits of all time, this movie delivers the ultimate encounter when aliens launch an invasion against the human race. The spectacle begins when massive spaceships appear. Wonder turns to terror as the ships blast destructive beams of fire down on cities all over the planet. Now the world’s only hope lies with determined survivors, uniting for one last strike against the invaders - before it’s the end of mankind. Cast includes Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum and Mary McDonnell.

results.title: Incredible Floridas
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Incredible Floridas is composer Richard Meale’s homage to the French poet, Arthur Rimbaud. Scored for woodwind, percussion and string instruments, it was written for the “Fires of London” and their conductor, Peter Maxwell Davies, and premiered in London in 1971 to a enthusiastic reception. Richard Meale is a leader in contemporary music in Australia. Also available on DVD [319174].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Peter Weir

results.title: Increasing productivity and efficiency: setting the right climate
results.creator_credit: BNA Communications and Pare Lorentz Jr
results.brief_description: Delves into teamwork, what it is and is not, how to institute it, the climate in which it flourishes. Portrays a five-point model for critiquing progress and discusses the line manager’s vital role as a paraprofessional trainer.
results.title_for_label: Increasing productivity and efficiency: setting the right climate

results.title: Incontinence: a diarrhetic flow of obvious mismatches
results.creator_credit: De Landa and Manuel De Landa
results.brief_description: Experimental film dealing with film editing and the visual image. Contains seven individual sequences of mismatching dialogue/actors/scenes with all scenes based on actual dialogue from “Who’s afraid of Virginia Woolf?”. However, a comic nightmare takes place and a healthy disregard for the text creates quite a bizarre interpretation of this well-known piece of literature. Cast includes Dina Paisner, Ken Burns, Patrick Gerstle, Susan Schneider and others.

results.title: Including me. Parts I and II
results.creator_credit: Indiana University. Audio Visual Center and Linda Janower
results.brief_description: Part I documents some of the problems encountered by handicapped individuals and explains how recent Federal legislation can help them find school programs appropriate to their needs. Part II focuses on four handicapped individuals who have succeeded in making progress in educational settings.
